item.title: FanDuel Launches Latest Prediction Markets App, Chasing Rivals
item.description: FanDuel, the US online gambling division of Flutter Entertainment Plc, launched its own prediction market product in five states just days after its main rival, DraftKings Inc., rolled out a similar product.

item.title: Bond Traders’ Big Bet Targets US 10-Year Back to 4% Within Weeks
item.description: Traders are loading up on Treasury options targeting a bond rally that would send US 10-year yields back to 4% in coming weeks, a level not seen since the end of November.

item.title: CEO of Boeing and Lockheed Rocket Joint Venture ULA Resigns
item.description: Tory Bruno, the chief executive officer of Boeing Co. and Lockheed Martin Corp.’s rocket joint venture United Launch Alliance, has resigned after serving in the position for nearly 12 years.

item.title: Thiel-Backed Bank Set to Double Valuation to $4.35 Billion
item.description: A Silicon Valley-focused banking startup backed by Palantir Technologies Inc. co-founder Peter Thiel is expected to raise $350 million in a funding round that would more than double its valuation.

item.title: ECB’s Schnabel Doesn’t Expect Rate Hikes in Foreseeable Future
item.description: European Central Bank Executive Board member Isabel Schnabel said she doesn’t expect interest rates to be lifted for some time.

item.title: Wheat, Soybeans Climb on Black Sea Port Attacks, Export Outlook
item.description: Wheat jumped as escalating tension between Russia and Ukraine sparked concerns over crop exports from the Black Sea region. Soybeans also rose.

item.title: One Chart That Helps Explain Surging Auto Delinquencies
item.description: Hello and welcome to the newsletter, a grab bag of daily content from the Odd Lots universe. Sometimes it's us, Joe Weisenthal and Tracy Alloway, bringing you our thoughts on the most recent developments in markets, finance and the economy. And sometimes it's contributions from our network of expert guests and sources. Whatever it is, we promise it will always be interesting.

item.title: Wells Fargo to Expand Into Clearing the $3.9 Trillion-a-Day Options Market
item.description: Wells Fargo & Co.’s global-markets business is expanding into options clearing, a capital intensive and operationally arduous corner of finance dominated by Bank of America Corp. and Goldman Sachs Group Inc.

item.title: Alphabet to Buy Data Center Partner Intersect for $4.75 Billion
item.description: Alphabet Inc. has agreed to buy clean energy developer Intersect Power LLC for $4.75 billion in cash, plus its existing debt, marking one of the largest deals by the tech giant in its push to dramatically expand its data center footprint to power AI.

item.title: Saylor’s Strategy Raises Cash Reserve, Pauses Bitcoin Purchases
item.description: Michael Saylor’s Strategy Inc. bolstered its cash reserve to $2.19 billion and paused purchases of Bitcoin over the past week as the largest digital asset treasury company appears to be settling in for a long crypto winter.

item.title: Target, Walmart, Whole Foods Targeted in ByHeart Botulism Suits
item.description: Target Corp., Whole Foods Market and Walmart Inc. will be added as defendants in lawsuits against baby formula maker ByHeart for selling a product potentially contaminated with spores that cause infant botulism.

item.title: Axia Falls Most Since 2020 as Reorganization Fuels Adjustment
item.description: Shares in Brazilian power company Axia Energia plunged after a share reorganization tied to a bonus equity issuance announced Friday caused a sharp adjustment in prices.

item.title: How Gold’s Safe-Haven Appeal Is Fueling Record Prices
item.description: For centuries, gold has been the go-to haven asset in times of political and economic uncertainty. Its status as a reliably high-value commodity that can be transported easily and sold anywhere offers a sense of safety when everything else is in turmoil.

item.title: Daiwa Revives M&A Hiring to Boost Global Status, Ride Japan Wave
item.description: Daiwa Securities Group Inc. is resuming an expansion of its mergers and acquisitions business to capitalize on a dealmaking boom at home and lift its standing abroad.

item.title: Cyberattack Hits French Postal Service, Delaying Mail Deliveries
item.description: A suspected cyberattack disrupted services provided by French postal service La Poste on Monday, delaying package deliveries and online payment systems during the holiday season.

item.title: Moody’s to Relocate Headquarters to Manhattan’s Brookfield Place
item.description: Moody’s Corp. is moving its headquarters to Brookfield Place in lower Manhattan.

item.title: Landlord SBB Says It Can Cover Maturing Debt After S&P Downgrade
item.description: Swedish landlord SBB is likely to see a swift return of its credit rating to CCC after Standard & Poor’s cut the measure of risk to “selective default” based on a recent bond repurchase program, according to Treasury Director Helena Lindahl.

item.title: Russia’s Oil Plunges to $34 as US Sanctions Spark Huge Discounts
item.description: Russia’s flagship Urals crude oil slumped to about $34 a barrel in a signal that US sanctions on Moscow are having an impact.

item.title: Tech Propels Stock Benchmarks to Third-Straight Winning Session
item.description: US equities advanced at Monday’s open with strategists expecting a year-end rally to take hold amid bullish positioning into tech stocks.

item.title: M&A Boom Has Room to Run: Dealmakers’ Predictions for 2026
item.description: Huge takeovers agreed across railways, drugstores, film studios, video game makers and more, mean dealmakers’ roughly $4.5 trillion haul for 2025 is their second biggest on record.

item.title: Meta’s Threads Makes a Play for Podcasters and Their Rabid Fans
item.description: The social network is launching podcast previews in a bid to attract more creators to the app

item.title: Mexico’s $41 Billion Debt Binge Made Pemex Best Bond in Latam
item.description: An unprecedented flood of support from Mexico’s government this year led to a windfall for Petroleos Mexicanos debt investors.

item.title: Fed Risks Recession Without More Interest Rate Cuts, Miran Says
item.description: Federal Reserve Governor Stephen Miran said the US central bank risks sparking a recession unless it continues lowering interest rates next year.

item.title: The Best Video Games of 2025
item.description: Almost all of them are independently developed, which speaks to the state of the games industry

item.title: Telefonica to Cut 5,500 Jobs With Total Cost of €2.5 Billion
item.description: Telefonica SA will book a cost of €2.5 billion ($2.9 billion) to pay for the exit of about 5,500 employees as part of a sweeping cost-reduction plan.

item.title: South Africa Court Rejected a $3.2 Billion Eskom Tariff Deal, MNY Says
item.description: A South African court rejected a 54 billion-rand ($3.2 billion) settlement between the nation’s energy regulator and electricity provider over a tariff-calculation mistake that would have seen power prices raised by more than previously permitted, Moneyweb reported.

item.title: Launch of CPC Mooring Is Delayed Again Amid Bad Weather
item.description: The relaunch of a second mooring at the Caspian Pipeline Consortium terminal has once again been delayed, according to two people familiar with the situation.

item.title: Cocoa Rebounds as Traders Eye Buying Amid Index Rebalancing
item.description: Cocoa rebounded from the lowest in almost two weeks in New York, amid expectations of looming index-related buying and lingering uncertainty over supplies.

item.title: Europe’s IPO Hopefuls Are Now Thinking Twice About Listing Abroad
item.description: After years of rapid growth, UK fintech startup SumUp is at a point where it’s considering an initial public offering. But that’s sparked a thorny question: where to list?

item.title: Cintas Makes Another Attempt to Buy Out Rival UniFirst
item.description: Cintas Corp. proposed a renewed takeover bid of UniFirst Corp. worth about $3.96 billion in equity in another attempt to buy out the rival uniform maker.
